Villa Savoye, Le Corbusier, 1928: Poissy, France
Villa Stein - de Monzie, Le Corbusier, 1927: Garches, France
Site Plan, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, 1927: Stuttgart, Germany, Weissenhof Settlement
Horseshoe Settlement, Bruno Taut, (1925 - 1927): Berlin-Britz, Germany
Settlement, Walter Gropius, (1926 - 1928): Dessau-Törten, Germany
Dymaxion House, Buckminster Fuller, 1930: Project
Maison de Verre, Pierre Chareau, (1928 - 1932): Paris, France
Casa del Fascio, Giuseppe Terragni, (1932 - 1936): Como, Italy
Palazzo della Civiltà Italiana, Guerrini, La Padula, and Romano, (1938 - 1943): Rome, Italy
Zeppelinfeld, Albert Speer, 1936: Nuremberg, Germany
McMillan Plan, Senate Park Commission, 1902: Washington, D.C.
Lincoln Memorial, Henry Bacon, (1914 - 1922): Washington, D.C.
Jefferson Memorial, John Russell Pope, (1939 - 1943): Washington, D.C.
Chicago Tribune Competition, Walter Gropius, 1922: Project
Chicago Tribune Competition, Eliel Saarinen, 1922: Project
Chicago Tribune Building, John Mead Howells and Raymond Hood, (1924 - 1928): Chicago, IL
Chrysler Building, William Van Alen, (1928 - 1930): New York, NY
PSFS Building, Howe and Lescaze, 1932: Philadelphia, PA
Ennis House, Frank Lloyd Wright, 1923: Los Angeles, CA
Kaufmann House (Fallingwater), Frank Lloyd Wright, (1936 - 1939): Bear Run, PA
Johnson Wax Company Administration Building, Frank Lloyd Wright, (1936 - 1939): Racine, WI
Lovell Health House, Richard Neutra, (1927 - 1929): Los Angeles, CA
Lovell Beach House, Rudolf Schindler, 1926: Newport Beach, CA
Illinois Institute of Technology, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, 1956: Chicago, IL
Farnsworth House, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, (1945 - 1951): Plano, IL
Glass House, Philip Johnson, 1949: New Canaan, CT
Lever Brothers Building, Natalie Griffin de Blois with Gordon Bunshaft at Skidmore, Owings and Merrill (SOM), 1952: New York, NY
Lake Shore Drive Apartments, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, (1949 - 1951): Chicago, IL
Seagram Building, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, (1956 - 1958): New York City, NY
